Description: Measuring(?) vessel of banded calcite; two handles beneath rim; three handles on lid; capacity inscribed on side.
Curator's comments: A group of papers were found in the vessel (April 2001), ahead of a loan to Barcelona: * A signed statement in Italian, stating the vase was acquired in Rosetta on May 28th 1819, by the "British agent in Rosetta, Mr. Lenzi". * A translation of the above, seemingly in Birch's handwriting * Some jottings on the inscription * Another note, in English, mentioning Mr. Lenzi Published: Sacred Food, Barcelona 2001, p. 186 [48].
Exhibition history: Exhibited: 1989 Jan-Mar, South Florida Science Museum, Imhotep's Egypt: Discovering Ancient Egyptian Technology 1989 Apr-Jun, Miami, Museum of Science, Imhotep's Egypt: Discovering Ancient Egyptian Technology 1989 Jul-Aug, Jacksonville Museum of Science History, Imhotep's Egypt: Discovering Ancient Egyptian Technology 2001 30 Jun-30 Sep, Barcelona, Sacred Food
